name: Marching Band
description: Covering the music of Western-derived marching bands, primarily used for entertainment, competition, military, and parade settings, typically involving large-scale orchestras featuring a variety of instruments.

sub_genres.name: Beni
sub_genres.description: Festive Zanzibari Marching Band music that emerged in the late 19th century.

sub_genres.name: Drum and Bugle Corps
sub_genres.description: Primarily uses drums and bugles, developed from North American military music.

sub_genres.name: Fife and Drum Corps
sub_genres.description: Derived from military field music, primarily uses fifes and drums.

sub_genres.name: Guggenmusik
sub_genres.description: Alemannic type of Marching Band played at carnival events, featuring a cacophonous, seemingly "out of tune" sound.

sub_genres.name: Pep Band
sub_genres.description: Performs at athletic events, and typically performs modified versions of Pop songs.

sub_genres.name: Pipe Band
sub_genres.description: Tradition originating in the Scottish military; standard instruments consist of 6-25 sets of Great Highland bagpipes, 3-10 military snare drums, 1-6 Scottish tenor drums, and one bass drum.
